image.description: Number line with points {{p1_numbers}} graphed accurately between {{p1_a}} and {{p1_b}}.

outtro.p: Note that the above are only examples. They may not be the only {{p1_how_many}} numbers possible.
Note that the above are only examples. They may not be the only {{p2_how_many}} numbers possible.

intro.p: F3-E (This explanation skill appears on the back of F3. Passing F3-E is separate from passing F3.)

content.p: In language appropriate for an elementary student, what does the denseness property of the rational numbers say?
Explain how one or both of your examples from the previous page helps to demonstrate this property.
Suppose a student challenged you to find {{expl_how_many}} numbers between the given two rational numbers. What would you do? (You do not need to write out {{expl_how_many}} individual numbers.)
